class.name: Word.BorderCollection
class.description: Represents the collection of border styles.

properties.name: context
properties.description: The request context associated with the object. This connects the add-in's process to the Office host application's process.

properties.name: insideBorderColor
properties.description: Specifies the 24-bit color of the inside borders. Color is specified in '#RRGGBB' format or by using the color name.

properties.name: insideBorderType
properties.description: Specifies the border type of the inside borders.

properties.name: insideBorderWidth
properties.description: Specifies the width of the inside borders.

properties.name: items
properties.description: Gets the loaded child items in this collection.

properties.name: outsideBorderColor
properties.description: Specifies the 24-bit color of the outside borders. Color is specified in '#RRGGBB' format or by using the color name.

properties.name: outsideBorderType
properties.description: Specifies the border type of the outside borders.

properties.name: outsideBorderWidth
properties.description: Specifies the width of the outside borders.

methods.name: getByLocation
methods.description: Gets the border that has the specified location.

params.name: borderLocation
params.type: Word.BorderLocation.top | Word.BorderLocation.left | Word.BorderLocation.bottom | Word.BorderLocation.right | Word.BorderLocation.insideHorizontal | Word.BorderLocation.insideVertical | "Top" | "Left" | "Bottom" | "Right" | "InsideHorizontal" | "InsideVertical"

methods.name: getFirst
methods.description: Gets the first border in this collection. Throws an ItemNotFound error if this collection is empty.

methods.name: getFirstOrNullObject
methods.description: Gets the first border in this collection. If this collection is empty, then this method will return an object with its isNullObject property set to true. For further information, see [*OrNullObject methods and properties](/en-us/office/dev/add-ins/develop/application-specific-api-model#ornullobject-methods-and-properties).

methods.name: getItem
methods.description: Gets a Border object by its index in the collection.

params.name: index
params.description: A number that identifies the index location of a Border object.

methods.name: load
methods.description: Queues up a command to load the specified properties of the object. You must call context.sync() before reading the properties.

params.name: options
params.description: Provides options for which properties of the object to load.

params.name: propertyNames
params.description: A comma-delimited string or an array of strings that specify the properties to load.

params.name: propertyNamesAndPaths
params.description: propertyNamesAndPaths.select is a comma-delimited string that specifies the properties to load, and propertyNamesAndPaths.expand is a comma-delimited string that specifies the navigation properties to load.

methods.name: toJSON
methods.description: Overrides the JavaScript toJSON() method in order to provide more useful output when an API object is passed to JSON.stringify(). (JSON.stringify, in turn, calls the toJSON method of the object that's passed to it.) Whereas the original Word.BorderCollection object is an API object, the toJSON method returns a plain JavaScript object (typed as Word.Interfaces.BorderCollectionData) that contains an "items" array with shallow copies of any loaded properties from the collection's items.

methods.name: track
methods.description: Track the object for automatic adjustment based on surrounding changes in the document. This call is a shorthand for [context.trackedObjects.add(thisObject)](/en-us/javascript/api/office/officeextension.clientrequestcontext#office-officeextension-clientrequestcontext-trackedobjects-member). If you're using this object across .sync calls and outside the sequential execution of a ".run" batch, and get an "InvalidObjectPath" error when setting a property or invoking a method on the object, you need to add the object to the tracked object collection when the object was first created. If this object is part of a collection, you should also track the parent collection.

methods.name: untrack
methods.description: Release the memory associated with this object, if it has previously been tracked. This call is shorthand for [context.trackedObjects.remove(thisObject)](/en-us/javascript/api/office/officeextension.clientrequestcontext#office-officeextension-clientrequestcontext-trackedobjects-member). Having many tracked objects slows down the host application, so please remember to free any objects you add, once you're done using them. You'll need to call context.sync() before the memory release takes effect.
